channel.title: Why did I just take the quiz?
channel.description: Now that I am positive there are no bugs in the quiz, all members that were registered before the quiz was implemented now have to take it in order to post. Sorry for the inconvenience but it is for the good of the community because it weeds out those people who are not willing to help themselves.

item.title: Why did I just take the quiz?
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

To me they mean pretty much the same.

Read full topic
item.source: Why did I just take the quiz?

item.title: Why did I just take the quiz?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Hassle != Annoyance.

Hassle = a problem brought about by pressures of time, money, inconvenience, etc.
Annoyance = a person or thing that annoys; nuisance.

Read full topic
item.source: Why did I just take the quiz?

item.title: Why did I just take the quiz?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:44, topic:64144”]Should make them hard questions you can’t Google…
Weed out the noobs one by one… and every time you miss a question-You lose 100post count lol
So some noobs might pass-but have -1000 post count? :[/quote]

Then we would only have 10 members if there are hard questions you can’t Google.
Removing post count would only be hard to code.

The only effective way I can think of is to put a new quiz every week. Either it’s a piece of cake or you don’t know enough programming and it’s a hassle to answer.

Read full topic
item.source: Why did I just take the quiz?

So some noobs might pass-but have -1000 post count? :[/quote]

SIGH post cont is irrevelentto this. Also, if someone were to say oh i have a higher post count than you, they would be luahged at since post count means nothing.
